Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Snort \Snort\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Snorted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Snorting}.] [OE. snorten; akin to snoren. See {Snore}.] 1. To force the air with violence through the nose, so as to make a noise, as do high-spirited horsed in prancing and play. --Fairfax. [1913 Webster]
2. To snore. [R.] ``The snorting citizens.'' --Shak. [1913 Webster]
3. To laugh out loudly. [Colloq.] --Halliwell. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Snort \Snort\, n. The act of snorting; the sound produced in snorting. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Snort \Snort\, v. t. To expel throught the nostrils with a snort; to utter with a snort. --Keats. [1913 Webster]

snort n 1: a disrespectful laugh [syn: {snicker}, {snigger}] 2: a cry or noise made to express displeasure or contempt [syn: {boo}, {hoot}, {Bronx cheer}, {hiss}, {raspberry}, {razzing}, {bird}] v 1: indicate contempt by breathing noisily and forcefully through the nose; "she snorted her disapproval of the proposed bridegroom" 2: make a snorting sound by exhaling hard; "The critic snorted contemtuously" 3: inhale recreational drugs [syn: {huff}] 4: inhale through the nose [syn: {take a hit}] 5: ingest through the nose; "The drug addict was snorting cocaine every night"
